label: Record Number
desc: corresponds to the record (row) number and has no effect on the output.

label: Random Values
desc: contains random values and has no effect on customer leaving the bank.

label: Surname
desc: the surname of a customer has no impact on their decision to leave the bank.

label: Credit Score
desc: can have an effect on customer churn, since a customer with a higher credit score is less likely to leave the bank.

label: Location
desc: a customer’s location can affect their decision to leave the bank.

label: Gender
desc: it’s interesting to explore whether gender plays a role in a customer leaving the bank.

label: Age
desc: this is certainly relevant, since older customers are less likely to leave their bank than younger ones.

label: Years as Client
desc: refers to the number of years that the customer has been a client of the bank. Normally, older clients are more loyal and less likely to leave a bank.

label: Account Balance
desc: also a very good indicator of customer churn, as people with a higher balance in their accounts are less likely to leave the bank compared to those with lower balances.

label: Number of Products
desc: refers to the number of products that a customer has purchased through the bank.

label: Has Credit Card
desc: denotes whether or not a customer has a credit card. This column is also relevant, since people with a credit card are less likely to leave the bank.

label: Active Customer
desc: active customers are less likely to leave the bank.

label: Salary
desc: as with balance, people with lower salaries are more likely to leave the bank compared to those with higher salaries.

label: Left Bank
desc: whether or not the customer left the bank.
